title: Why Na2SO4 solution conducts better than NaCl

content.question: A 0.10 M aqueous solution of sodium sulfate, Na2SO4 , is a better conductor of electricity than a 0.10 M aqueous solution of sodium chloride, NaCl. Which of the following best explains this observation?

choices.label: Na2SO4 is more soluble in water than NaCl is.
Na2SO4 has a higher molar mass than NaCl has.
More moles of ions are present in a given volume of 0.10 M Na2SO4 than in the same volume of 0.10 M NaCl.
The degree of dissociation of Na2SO4 in solution is significantly greater than that of NaCl.

content.answer: More moles of ions are present in a given volume of 0.10 M Na2SO4 than in the same volume of 0.10 M NaCl.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
